column4: Hello, I have the exact same file permissions on files in two different folders under the same parent but the user is only able to see the contents of one of those folders. Any ideas?
what are the permissions on the folders themselves?
you can lsattr on the files
so no special attributes are set on those files. unless you are reading ls -l wrong i'm not sure what it might be
I wish... they are literally the same. I dont have selinux installed... i don't have acls enabled
are they on the same partition? can you touch files in the folders?
as my user yes, as the user "media" i can't even see them.
but as this "media" user you can see one folder but not the other?

I can see every folder. Today I uploaded some data to the server as "me". As media I can see those folders along with everything that was already there. I can't see any of the files in the newly uploaded folders as media.
but the permissions and ownership of the files that cant be seen are the same as the previous files (ie you setgid on the folder)
How do you pm someone?
pm is discouraged in this channel
ok. http://paste.ubuntu.com/1116684/
the folder with the new files is cut off but the files inside seem to have the correct permissions
cerebro@gHome:~$ ls -al /media/hardDrive1TB-2/gh/Movies/Children/New Movie/
and the "New Movie" folder has permissions cerebro users drwxrwxr-x
both have this: drwxrwxr-x 2 cerebro users
and how are you accessing these files with the "media" user? direct access or some kind of samba/nfs thing?
it is done with samba
then its probably a misconfiguration of samba
media user can access everything else....
maybe there is a weird character in the folder name that samba chokes on. but i would suspect something with the samba stack
ok.. i will poke around samba some more toight. Thanks for looking at taht stuff for me
